actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 95-251.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: An original resolution authorizing additional committee expenditures.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 95-251) Authorizes the expenditure of funds, not to exceed $2,683,200, by the Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs for hearings and investigations. Authorizes the Committee to study or investigate: (1) the efficiency and economy of operations of all branches of the Government; (2) the extent to which criminal or improper practices are engaged in labor-management relations; (3) syndicated or organized crime; (4) all other aspects of crime and lawlessness impacting the national safety; (5) riots, vandalism, and civil and criminal disorder; and (6) the efficiency of Government operations with reference to national security and management of energy shortages.

titles.title: An original resolution authorizing additional committee expenditures.
